name: Jon Batiste
description:
'''Jonathan Michael Batiste''' (born November 11, 1986) is an American singer, songwriter, musician, composer, bandleader, television personality and actor. He has recorded and performed with artists including [[Alicia Keys]], [[Stevie Wonder]], [[Prince (musician)|Prince]], [[Willie Nelson]], [[Lenny Kravitz]], [[ASAP Rocky]], [[Ed Sheeran]], [[Lana Del Rey]], [[Roy Hargrove]], [[Juvenile (rapper)|Juvenile]], and [[Mavis Staples]]. Batiste appeared nightly with his band, [[Stay Human (band)|Stay Human]], as bandleader and musical director on ''[[The Late Show with Stephen Colbert]]'' from 2015 to 2022.

Batiste also serves as the music director of ''[[The Atlantic]]'' and the Creative Director of the [[National Jazz Museum in Harlem]]. In 2020, he co-composed the score for the [[Pixar]] animated film ''[[Soul (2020 film)|Soul]]'', for which he received an [[Academy Award for Best Original Score|Academy Award]], a [[Golden Globe Award for Best Original Score|Golden Globe Award]], a [[Grammy Award for Best Score Soundtrack for Visual Media|Grammy Award]] and a [[BAFTA Award for Best Original Music|BAFTA Film Award]] (all shared with [[Trent Reznor]] and [[Atticus Ross]]). Batiste has garnered eight [[Grammy Awards]] from 25 nominations, including an [[Grammy Award for Album of the Year|Album of the Year]] win for [[We Are (Jon Batiste album)|''We Are'']] (2021).

In 2023, Batiste was featured in the documentary film ''[[American Symphony (film)|American Symphony]],'' which records the process of Batiste composing his first symphony. In 2024, Batiste featured in the ensemble comedy-drama film ''[[Saturday Night (2024 film)|Saturday Night]]'', directed by [[Jason Reitman]], playing the role of musician [[Billy Preston]], as well as composing the film's score.
